page.title: 13Wortley Village
page.content: Wortley stands on high ground overlooking the River Don and is on the main Sheffield to Halifax road. It is a very old village. People were even living here in Anglo-Saxon times and it is mentioned in the Domesday Book. The houses have changed very little since they were rebuilt by Lord Wharncliffe about 150 years ago. They are made of stone with stone flagged roofs and look very quaint. They are clustered round the church which was first built in the 14th century. People who worked on the estate lived in them and their children went to the school that the earl built. Most of the people who live there now are retired. There are some new houses but the residents work away from Wortley either in the steel works or in the surrounding towns.
